form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Grassley (for himself and Mr. Donnelly) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To protect the information of livestock producers, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Farmer Identity Protection Act .

paragraph.text: United States livestock producers supply a vital link in the food supply of the United States, which is listed as a critical infrastructure by the Secretary of Homeland Security;
domestic terrorist attacks have occurred at livestock operations across the United States, endangering the lives and property of people of the United States;
State governments and agencies are the primary authority in almost all States for the protection of water quality under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1251 et seq.);
State agencies maintain records on livestock operations and have the authority to address water quality issues where needed; and
there is no discernible environmental or scientifically research-related need to create a database or other system of records of livestock operations in the United States by the Administrator.
The term Administrator means the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.
The term Agency means the Environmental Protection Agency.
The term livestock operation includes any operation involved in the raising or finishing of livestock and poultry.

subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (b), the Administrator, any officer or employee of the Agency, or any contractor or cooperator of the Agency, shall not disclose the information of any owner, operator, or employee of a livestock operation provided to the Agency by a livestock producer or a State agency in accordance with the Federal Water Pollution Control Act ( 33 U.S.C. 1251 et seq. ) or any other law, including—

paragraph.text: other identifying information regarding the location of the owner, operator, livestock, or employee.
the disclosure of information described in subsection (a) if—

subparagraph.text: the information has been transformed into a statistical or aggregate form at the county level or higher without any information that identifies the agricultural operation or agricultural producer; or
the livestock producer consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.text: the authority of any State agency to collect information on livestock operations; or
the authority of the Agency to disclose the information on livestock operations to State or other Federal governmental agencies.

subsection.header: Condition of permit or other programs
subsection.text: The approval of any permit, practice, or program administered by the Administrator shall not be conditioned on the consent of the livestock producer under subsection (b)(1)(B).
